entry.title: Consider setting LLVM_ENABLE_EXPORTED_SYMBOLS_IN_EXECUTABLE

We disable plugins too, so might as well pick this up.

entry.title: Better to add deselect Functionality in Color Picker beside close Icon to make it even more user-Friendly.
entry.content:
Chrome Version:125.0.6410.0 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable Installs & Version Pins) df36e4d901225fac74fa8a18dbf68522f4acf003-refs/branch-heads/6410@{#1}
OS : Win(10,11)
Preconditions: None
Steps to reproduce: 1.Launch Chrome and Open NTP 2.Click on Customize chrome 3.Clicl on colour picker 5.Observe that, Deselect/unselect option is not there beside close icon.
Actual Result:Deselect/unselect option is not there beside close icon. Expected Result:Better to add deselect Functionality beside close Icon to make it even more user-Friendly.
This issue exists from M-118 Onwards.So,raising it as a NR issue.
Please refer to the Attached screencast below:
Notes: 1)This issue able to repro on Stable #123.0.6312.122, Dev #125.0.6395.3 and Beta RC#124.0.6367.28 2)As this being a Non-Regression issue,changing the status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed.
Thanks..!!

entry.title: segmented_string_fuzzer: Timeout in segmented_string_fuzzer
entry.content:
Detailed Report: https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=4795861180547072
Fuzzing Engine: libFuzzer Fuzz Target: segmented_string_fuzzer Job Type: libfuzzer_chrome_asan Platform Id: linux
Crash Type: Timeout (exceeds 60 secs) Crash Address: Crash State: segmented_string_fuzzer
Sanitizer: address (ASAN)
Regressed: https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=libfuzzer_chrome_asan&range=1225797:1225809
Reproducer Testcase: https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=4795861180547072
Issue filed automatically.
See https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/testing/libfuzzer/reproducing.md for instructions on reproducing this bug locally.

entry.title: Incorrect layout being used for distillability detection
entry.content: URL: https://www.chinanews.com.cn/gn/2024/04-10/10196103.shtml (Any article from chinanews.com) Problem: When we log the features extracted for this page, all text length features are zero. On further inspection it can be seen that the layout being used for feature extraction is totally different from the actual layout. This phenomenon can also be observed on naver.com. On the other hand, if we download the pages and open them offline (.mhtml), then it's able to detect the text. *BODY NOSCRIPT #text "We're sorry but \u4E2D\u56FD\u65B0\u95FB\u7F51 doesn't work properly without JavaScript enabled. Please enable it to continue." DIV id="app" DIV class="app-div" DIV DIV #comment #comment DIV class="newscontent" DIV class="title" DIV class="pubtime" #comment DIV DIV #text " " #comment #comment #comment DIV class="content" #comment #comment #comment #comment #comment #comment #comment #comment SCRIPT SCRIPT

entry.title: Horizontal Scroll bar is not present to view the details properly.
entry.content:
Chrome Version:125.0.6410.0 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable Installs & Version Pins) df36e4d901225fac74fa8a18dbf68522f4acf003-refs/branch-heads/6410@{#1}
OS : Win(10,11)
Preconditions: None
Steps to reproduce: 1.Launch Chrome and Open NTP 2.Right Click and then Inspect 3.Go to memory Tab 4.Start recording in Allocation sampling(By selecting allocation sampling through check box). 5.Stop after few seconds. 6.Observe that, Horizontal Scroll bar is not present to view the details properly.
Actual Result:Horizontal Scroll bar is not present to view the details properly which makes it user un-friendly. Expected Result:Horizontal bar should be present to view the details properly.
This issue exists from M-118 Onwards.So,raising it as a NR issue.
Please refer to the Attached screencast below:
Notes: 1)This issue able to repro on Stable #123.0.6312.122, Dev #125.0.6395.3 and Beta RC#124.0.6367.28 2)As this being a Non-Regression issue,changing the status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed.
Thanks..!!

entry.title: [Password Manager: M3 - Migrating local passwords from Chrome to GMSCore] Offer to save passwords and Auto sign-in are enabled in password manager page.
entry.content:
Chrome version : 124.0.6367.20 Device Details : Samsung Galaxy M31S / SP1A.210812.016
Steps to reproduce: 1. Open Password manager shortcut which is added to home screen. 2. Tap on settings button --> Enable "Offer to save passwords" and "Auto sign-in". 3. Fresh launch chrome and do not enable sync 4. Disable #upm-local-no-migration and #upm-local-with-migration from chrome://flags 5. Go to https://rsolomakhin.github.io/autofill and save a password 6. Go to 3 dot menu --> Go to settings --> Go to password manager 7. Disable Save passwords toggle. 8. Enable #upm-local-no-migration and #upm-local-with-migration from chrome://flags and relaunch 9. wait for 30 seconds. 10. Go to 3 dot menu --> Go to settings --> Go to password manager --> Go to settings in password manager page > observe
Observed behavior: 1. Offer to save passwords and Auto sign-in are enabled
Expected behavior: 1. Offer to save passwords and Auto sign-in should be disabled.
Frequency : 5/5
Additional information : After clearing the data it is reproducible in Samsung Galaxy M31S / SP1A.210812.016

entry.title: Manifest V3 deadline - still cannot migrate extensions because ofa bug in DevTools
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 123.0.6312.106 (official build) (64-Bit)\ OS: Win10 19045.4170, MacOS 13.5
**Storyline:**
I am trying to migrate DevTools extensions from Manifest V2 to V3 as requested by Google until June 2024 (deadline). It uses the old V2 structure with Content Script, Background Page, DevTools Panel to transfer HTML contents/updates into the DevTools panel via messaging.
Following the official guide (https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/develop/migrate/to-service-workers) you run into the problem, the custom DevTools panel is failing.
So far other users including me narrowed down the problem to the Manifest V3 handling or DevTools itself.
**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1) use manifest v3 2) add devtools_page to manifest 3) add background.service_worker to manifest
Example: ```json { "manifest_version": 3, "name": "Custom DevTools Panel", "version": "1.0.0", "devtools_page": "devtools.html", "background": { "service_worker": "service-worker.js" } } ```
More details:
- https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40938559 - https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40945917
**What is the expected result?**
Custom DevTools Panel is rendered while Service Worker is running for the messaging.
**What happens instead?**
Custom DevTools panel does not show up when `background.service_worker` was set in Manifest v3.
**Does this issue affect a publicly-available extension?**
YES! - IDs:
- jfpdemgdamgplelnlmaecbonkfgfgomp - ... *(i dunno the IDs of the other authors)*
**What's next ...**
In case this analysis is wrong or we misunderstood the migration guide, I would appreciate if someone can tell how to use V3 correctly and I recommend an improvement of the migration guide.\ In case this analysis is correct, **we need a fix** of the issue weeks before the Manifest V3 deadline **or the deadline shifted** again.
Thanks for your support!

entry.title: [css-anchor-position] Persisting anchor query results ignores invalidation of the base style
"has been Google Translate added to Chrome" is displayed instead of "Google Translate has been added to Chrome" when Force-UI:Right-To-Left(RTL) flag is enabled
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 125.0.6410.0 (Official Build) canary (arm64) df36e4d901225fac74fa8a18dbf68522f4acf003-refs/branch-heads/6410@{#1}
OS : Mac,Linux
Preconditions: #force-ui-direction -Right-to-Left- Enabled
Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch Chrome and enable Force-UI:Right-to-Left(RTL) flag 2. Go to Chrome Web Store and add any extension(ex: Google Translate) 3. Observe that the pop-up displays "has been Google Translate added to Chrome" instead of "Google Translate has been added to Chrome"
Actual Result: "has been Google Translate added to Chrome" is displayed when Google Translate extension is added
Expected Result: "Google Translate has been added to Chrome" must be displayed when Google Translate extension is added
This issue exists from M-113 onwards .So, raising it as a NR issue.
Please refer to the attached screenshot.
Notes: 1)This issue able to repro on Beta #124.0.6367.29, Dev #125.0.63896.3 and Stable #123.0.6312.107 2)As this is a Non-Regression issue, changing the status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed. 3)This issue is not repro on Windows
Thanks..!!

entry.title: a11y-tree: Disabled state of a button inside a web-component does not adapt to changes
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create a web-component with a simple button tag inside. Add the disabled attribute to that button. 2. The button and its disabled state are correctly shown in the a11y tree. 3. Programmatically set disabled=false to allow interaction with the button. 4. The button can now be used without problems e.g. with mouse or keyboard or a screenreader such as NVDA 5. BUT the button still has the disabled state in the a11y tree and the screenreader announces it as "unavailable".
# Problem Description The current disabled-state of a button inside a web-component is not correctly updated after programmatic changes. Screenreader software continues to announce the button as "unavailable" if that was its initial state. This only happens if the button is inside a web-component. This happens with various screenreaders such as JAWS and NVDA. This does not happen with Firefox.
# Summary a11y-tree: Disabled state of a button inside a web-component does not adapt to changes
# Additional Data Category: JavaScript \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Render crashes when deactivating css property and selecting pseudo element
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create an html document 2. assign a css property to an element 3. in the same css rule, add a nested pseudo-element 4. open html document 5. deactivate that css property 6. select the pseudo element in the elements tab 7. the page crashes, ` STATUS_BREAKPOINT` error
# Problem Description I think the problem might be on how chromium handles commenting css properties with nesting elements in the same rule.
Attached an html file to reproduce the error following the steps.
# Summary Render crashes when deactivating css property and selecting pseudo element
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Canary \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Stop exposing JSGlobalObject via V8 Api
entry.content:
The JavaScript global object in V8 is represented as a "split object" ([1], [2]) - which is represented internally as `JSGlobalProxy` and `JSGlobalObject`. Accessing data through the former implies respective access checks required by the Web spec while accessing properties via the latter bypasses them and intended to be mostly an implementation detail.
Currently, V8 Api allows to get to the JSGlobalObject via ``` v8::Local<v8::Context> context = ...; global_obj = context->Global()->GetPrototype(); ``` while according to the spec [3] the `[[GetPrototypeOf]]` for `WindowProxy` (represented by `JSGlobalProxy` on V8 side) should not return the hidden `Window` object (represented by `JSGlobalObject` on V8 side).
Current behaviour allowed embedders to accidentally abuse the V8 Api and introduce security issues in the past.
The proposed solution is to never expose the `JSGlobalObject` via V8 Api and make the `v8::Object::GetPrototype()` skip the `JSGlobalObject`.
Given that the embedder Api callbacks will no longer need to access the `JSGlobalObject` this will allow us to simplify the V8's IC system (by merging `kApiGetter` with `kApiGetterHolderIsPrototype` and `kApiSetter` with `kApiSetterHolderIsPrototype` IC states) and by simplifying the meaning of `v8::FunctionCallbackInfo::Holder()` [4].
---- [1] https://wiki.mozilla.org/Gecko:SplitWindow
[2] https://whatwg.org/C/browsers.html#the-windowproxy-exotic-object
[3] https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/nav-history-apis.html#windowproxy-getprototypeof
[4] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:v8/include/v8-function-callback.h;l=130?q=file:v8-function-callback.h%20Holder()

entry.title: Investigate making Sparkplug compilation unbatched and non-concurrent
entry.content: Sparkplug compiles quickly enough that it pays for itself, especially since we no longer need to flip page flags. We might get better performance by keeping it on the main thread and removing batching, which reduces the delay before the interpreter can tier up, reduces the risk of a priority inversion with the background compilation, and frees up background threads to do other things. OTOH maybe it regresses because of needing more time on the main thread -- this needs measurement.

entry.title: Text Fragments: Wrong expectation in WPT re. percent encoding
entry.content:
Hi y'all, Gecko dev here.
I've noticed that the [expected results](https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/rev/1f27a4022f9f1269d897526c1c892a57743e650c/testing/web-platform/tests/scroll-to-text-fragment/percent-encoding.html#36-45) for parsing text directives that only consist of one or two `%` signs seem to be wrong. According to my interpretation of the [URL spec](https://url.spec.whatwg.org/#percent-decode), a percent sign without two following characters should be interpreted as a percent sign, not as percent-encoding. The [rust crate](https://crates.io/crates/percent-encoding) we're using for percent-encoding/decoding aligns to this behavior.
Even if this would be a [validation error](https://url.spec.whatwg.org/#validation-error), IMO that should be silently ignored to try and parse the text directive regardless. It seems that [WebKit](https://wpt.fyi/results/scroll-to-text-fragment/percent-encoding.html?q=%2Fscroll-to-text-fragment%2Fpercent-encoding.html&run_id=5083309062750208&run_id=5135706590019584&run_id=5167196803694592&run_id=5099233727741952) does this as well.
Unless you disagree, I intend to change the expected result of these WPTs soon-ish.

entry.title: Set profile to require login on machine and utilized 2 factor authentication
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open Chrome and select profile 2. Each profile can be opened freely
# Problem Description In office or shared workstation environment, we might need to access our own profile that we sync in cloud and keep it there for convenient. But it was unsafe to left it there and could be access without any restriction
I wish I could specified that, in that machine, some of profile need to login with 2 factor verification from my phone. So I can open my profile, click yes button on my phone, and start working. But no one can open my profile on chrome in that machine without my approval
It should do this process every time the chrome was opened for each profile. So we can conveniently close the chrome and secure our profile on the machine. And using 2factor is also more convenient and more secure than password
# Summary Set profile to require login on machine and utilized 2 factor authentication
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Type-Feature - Request for new or improved features
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Interest Group joined at Chrome is not available for the Auction executed on WebView
entry.content:
Protected Audience API is available at both webView & chrome. However, having an Interest Group joined at Chrome browser, that IG was not available at the Protected Audience Auction triggered within WebView .
This is essential since there are Ads displayed on WebView where Auction is required to run.
NOTE: we have followed google guideline and did verify that web view does support joining Protected Audience Interest Groups and running a Protected Audience Auction (as detailed at https://developers.google.com/privacy-sandbox/relevance/protected-audience-api#detect_feature_support).

entry.title: The phone does not respond after OTA to the target version, restart
